poem:
"Quiet Slaughter below Eden"

Their labour, in silence profound,
Anointed by Darwin's own hand.
Yet under ubiquity's shroud,
We force their invisible end.
Our Eden, betrayed by our art,
While stealth-kissed killers advance.
Humble, they toil in the dark,
A mere casualty in our dance.
Their silent song, forever still. 
Can Eden live, with their death's chill?

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
